Class FileWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapper.FileWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFileWrapper

    public final class FileWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFileWrapper
    Singleton pattern
    Author:
    Peter, Matti

    • Field Summary

      private static FileWrapper instance
      The only instance of FileWrapper we allow to exist

      Opens a given file in it's native applications as specified in the Operating system.
      boolean saveExcelFiletoCustomerFolder(java.io.File inputFile, Customer inputCustomer)
      We actually don't use this method anymore - the idea behind it was good, but errors occured when we tried to copy from a file that had just been edited in - i think it has something to do with our createExcel sheet that atleast throws 1+ mistake in the excel sheet that demands to be handled before it gives permission to copy content
      java.io.File saveFileToCustomerFolder(java.lang.String inputFilePath, Customer inputCustomer, int logEntryId)
      Method for saving a given input file to the customers filefolder.

      • saveExcelFiletoCustomerFolder

        public boolean saveExcelFiletoCustomerFolder(java.io.File inputFile,
                                    Customer inputCustomer)
        We actually don't use this method anymore - the idea behind it was good, but errors occured when we tried to copy from a file that had just been edited in - i think it has something to do with our createExcel sheet that atleast throws 1+ mistake in the excel sheet that demands to be handled before it gives permission to copy content
        Specified by:
        saveExcelFiletoCustomerFolder in interface IFileWrapper
        Parameters:
        inputFile -
        inputCustomer -
        Returns:
        boolean

      • saveFileToCustomerFolder

        public java.io.File saveFileToCustomerFolder(java.lang.String inputFilePath,
                                    Customer inputCustomer,
                                    int logEntryId)
        Method for saving a given input file to the customers filefolder. We don't delete the original file, nor move it. It is copied so the original file stays intact. It then returns the new file for later us if needed.
        Specified by:
        saveFileToCustomerFolder in interface IFileWrapper
        Parameters:
        inputFilePath -
        inputCustomer -
        logEntryId -
        Returns:
        File
